rawData.title: Instagram head Adam Mosseri pushes back on MrBeast’s AI fears, but admits society will have to adjust | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Instagram head Adam Mosseri argues that AI will democratize content creation while acknowledging society must adapt to a world where video evidence can't be automatically trusted as real.

rawData.title: You can now connect your Spotify account to ChatGPT: Here’s how to do it | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: OpenAI has integrated Spotify into ChatGPT, allowing users to connect their accounts to create personalized playlists, get music recommendations, and control playback based on their listening history and preferences.

rawData.title: Apple’s executive reshuffling isn’t over
rawData.summary: Apple is reorganizing executive roles with Eddy Cue taking over health and fitness teams, while chip division head Johnny Srouji is reportedly considering his future with the company following the launch of Apple's first in-house modem.

rawData.title: So much for Ford and GM’s scheme to extend the EV tax credit
rawData.summary: Ford and GM abandoned their plan to extend the $7,500 EV tax credit through dealer lease arrangements after Republican senators flagged the strategy to the Treasury Department as a loophole.

rawData.title: Edifier’s new wireless speaker looks like a gaming PC
rawData.summary: Edifier has launched the Huazai New Cyber speaker in China, a Bluetooth speaker designed to look like a gaming PC with RGB lighting, exposed electronics, and a 2.8-inch display screen that can show system metrics when connected to a computer.

rawData.title: You can still get the latest AirPods Max at their Prime Day price
rawData.summary: Apple's USB-C AirPods Max headphones are available for $429.99 ($120 off) at major retailers, matching their Prime Day pricing and featuring 24-bit lossless audio playback capability when connected via USB-C.

rawData.title: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to advise Microsoft and Anthropic  | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has taken senior advisory roles at Microsoft and Anthropic, prompting concerns from Parliament's Advisory Committee about potential unfair access and influence in AI regulation and government affairs.

rawData.title: Fractal’s Scape is proof that $200 can get you a luxurious gaming headset
rawData.summary: Fractal Design's first gaming headset, the $200 Scape, features a minimalist Scandinavian design, magnetic charging dock, dual microphone options, and over 40 hours of battery life with customizable RGB lighting.

rawData.title: We’re all about to be in wearable hell
rawData.summary: Tech companies are increasingly pushing toward a future of multiple wearable devices per person, with major players like Google, Meta, and Samsung envisioning consumers wearing multiple AI-enabled accessories simultaneously on different body parts.

rawData.title: You can now buy Microsoft’s Windows XP Crocs for $79.95
rawData.summary: Microsoft is selling limited edition Windows XP-themed Crocs for $79.95, featuring the iconic wallpaper design and including Microsoft-themed charms like Clippy and Internet Explorer icons plus a matching drawstring backpack.

rawData.title: Maybe it’s real, maybe it’s Sora
rawData.summary: OpenAI is expanding ChatGPT's capabilities by adding third-party apps and developer tools, while also launching Sora, their new AI-powered social video platform, amid various strategic partnerships with chip companies.

rawData.title: Lab-grown meat does not a burger make, EU lawmakers insist
rawData.summary: The EU Parliament voted to ban the use of meat-related terms like 'burger' and 'sausage' for both plant-based and lab-grown meat products, with the measure passing 355-247 though still requiring final approval from the EU Commission and member states.

rawData.title: Brendan Carr wants to let internet providers charge hidden fees again
rawData.summary: FCC chairman Brendan Carr has proposed revising rules that require ISPs to itemize all fees on monthly bills, potentially allowing providers to obscure charges that were previously mandated to be transparent under Biden-era consumer protection rules.

rawData.title: Autonomous AI Hacking and the Future of Cybersecurity - Schneier on Security
rawData.summary: AI agents are now capable of autonomous hacking at machine speeds, with recent demonstrations showing they can find vulnerabilities, automate cyberattacks, and execute complex attack chains without human intervention.

rawData.title: Help Your Sleep Schedule Bounce Back With a Latex Mattress
rawData.summary: A comprehensive review of latex mattresses, highlighting their natural materials, bouncy support, and different types (Talalay, Dunlop, and latex foam), with specific recommendations for various sleep needs and preferences.

rawData.title: Copilot on Windows can now create Office documents and connect to Gmail
rawData.summary: Microsoft is updating Copilot on Windows to enable document creation directly from chat sessions and add connectivity with Gmail and Outlook accounts, allowing users to create Word, Excel, PowerPoint files and search email content through AI assistance.

rawData.title: While OpenAI races to build AI data centers, Nadella reminds us that Microsoft already has them | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella showcased the company's first massive AI system deployment featuring over 4,600 Nvidia GB300 rack computers with Blackwell Ultra GPUs, emphasizing Microsoft's existing global data center infrastructure advantage over OpenAI's future building plans.

rawData.title: The Minecraft movie is getting a sequel
rawData.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has announced a sequel to the Minecraft movie, set to release on July 23rd, 2027, with original director Jared Hess returning following the first film's massive success of nearly $1 billion at the box office.

rawData.title: Reflection AI raises $2B to be America's open frontier AI lab, challenging DeepSeek | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Reflection AI, founded by ex-Google DeepMind researchers, has raised $2B at an $8B valuation to build an open-source AI lab focused on developing frontier language models, positioning itself as both an alternative to closed AI labs and a Western competitor to Chinese AI firms.

rawData.title: AI models can acquire backdoors from surprisingly few malicious documents
rawData.summary: Research by Anthropic reveals that AI language models can develop backdoor vulnerabilities from as few as 250 corrupted documents in their training data, regardless of the model's size, contradicting previous assumptions that larger models would require proportionally more malicious content.
